greeting: Greetings from The On-Line Encyclopedia of Integer Sequences! http://oeis.org/

results.name: a(n) = p_1 + p_2 + ... + p_k, where p_1*p_2*...*p_k is the prime factorization of A064413(n).
link: Peter Kagey, Table of n, a(n) for n = 1..10000
formula: a(n) = A001414(A064413(n)) for n > 1. -- _Peter Kagey_, Sep 15 2016
example: For instance, a(4) = 5 because A064413(4) = 6, and 6 = 2*3; 2 + 3 = 5.
results.author: _Alec Jones_, Sep 05 2016
